page.title: 15 ANNE HATHAWAY'S COTTAGE
page.content: ANNE HATHAWAY'S COTTAGE IS ONE OF THE MOST COMMERCIALLY PROSPEROUS TOURIST ATTRACTIONS OF OUR AREA,AND HAS BEEN SO SINCE IT FIRST OPENED FOR PUBLIC VIEWING IN THE 1800'S. ANNE HATHAWAY,SHAKESPEARE'S WIFE,AND MOTHER TO HIS THREE CHILDREN LIVED,WITH HER FAMILY,IN THE COTTAGE WHICH AT THE TIME WAS A LARGE FARM CALLED "HEWLANDS FARMHOUSE".IT RETAINED THIS NAME UNTIL THE VICTORIAN ERA WHEN ITS OWNER MARY BAKER,A DESCENDANT OF THE HATHAWAY LINE RENAMED IT AS IT IS TODAY.THE HATHAWAY FAMILY LIVED IN THE FARMHOUSE FOR 13 GENERATIONS UNTIL JUST BEFORE THE FIRST WORLD WAR. ALMOST HALF A MILLION TOURISTS COME FROM ALL OVER THE WORLD EACH YEAR TO LOOK AROUND THE COTTAGE,WHICH IS SITUATED A MILE AND A HALF FROM THE TOWN CENTRE OF STRATFORD-UPON-AVON,IN THE VILLAGE OF SHOTTERY.
